data.title: [WIP] random map scripts (already working)
data.body:
a simple random map generator

gets a rms file and tries to make a map which can be loaded within the game.

important: if the map is for more than 2 players, you need to add more playernames in the menu, otherwise openage will crash.

how does it work?
./rms.py oasis.rms
will generate a /tmp/default_save.oas file which can be loaded

what works:
can create Islands (Water,Grass) with shapes(random flood fill) and placement(in circle, random, and within a bounding box)
connection: from island center to another island center with terrain costs
object placement: random, in a circle, filling whole island
nearly everything has paramenters which can be tweaked
new map can be generated with a different seed

data.title: What is the intended approach for an installed launch?

milestone.title: Next release
milestone.description: We have a working Qt GUI and many more features! This release is soooo overdue...

data.body:
[openage.desktop](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/f9f26c83555f13138be2193c8a315758805758eb/dist/openage.desktop) file:

``` desktop
Exec=openage %u
Path=.openage
```

Which no longer works since qml files are also expected to be sitting next to `./assets`. On an installed system the qml files are in `/usr/share/openage` while the assets are in `~/.openage/assets`. Short of symlinking the assets into `/usr/share/openage` and launching the game from that directory there does not appear to be a way to run it outside of a development setup where everything is in a single directory.

Seems like there needs to be some path discovery or somesuch.

data.title: [WIP]? Crosscompile for windows with MXE
data.body:
Currently crashing on zero pointer. Needs manual python configuration.

Prepare MXE:

```
git clone https://github.com/mxe/mxe/
cd mxe
make MXE_TARGETS='x86_64-w64-mingw32.shared.posix' opusfile freetype sdl2 sdl2_image libepoxy qt5 dlfcn-win32
export PATH=$(pwd)/usr/bin:$PATH
```

Prepare wine with python (needs `python-3.4.0.amd64.msi` ):

```
WINEARCH=win64 wine wineboot
wine msiexec /i python-3.4.0.amd64.msi /qn
wine c:/Python34/python.exe -m pip install numpy
```

Cross-compile openage:

```
mkdir build-openage
cd build-openage
x86_64-w64-mingw32.shared.posix-cmake ../openage/
make -j
```

data.title: Can't stop the game while it is loading assets
data.body: On first launch, openage usually takes ~4-5 minutes to load all assets for me. During that time, pressing SHIFT-ESC in game or Ctrl-C in the console doesn't actually stop the game. It waits until all assets are loaded, then it immediately stops.

noexcept annotation for all move constructors/assignment ops
data.body:
Annotate all move constructors/assignment operators should be annotated `noexcept`, because stl containers will not move the values when reallocating otherwise.

Instead, they will copy the values to ensure a valid state when the move might except.

-> Go through the whole code base (`grep` or `ag` for `&&`) and annotate all constructors/functions that actually don't except with the `noexcept` keyword.

http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/noexcept_spec

data.title: Selection box actions
data.body:
Don't test if the mouse button is down when dragging the selection box. Use new actions `BEGIN_SELECTION` and `END_SELECTION` instead.

To do that, add new `MOUSE_BUTTON_UP` and `MOUSE_BUTTON_DOWN` events to have them separately from the mouse clicks. Bind them to the selection actions.

Needed by #584, so during the input replay the `ActionMode` doesn't try to access the main `InputManager` by doing `engine.get_input_manager().is_down(input::event_class::MOUSE_BUTTON, 1)`.

data.title: Build system C++14 broken
data.body:
So, build system for some reason first sets -std=c++14, then -std=gnu++11, which breaks all the C++14 functions. Hackfix:
1. mkdir build && cd build
2. nano libopenage/CMakeFiles/libopenage.dir/flags.make
3. replace -std=gnu++11 with -std=gnu++14
4. Ctrl+X, Y to save any exit.
5. make
